content:
StatefulServiceDescription.MinReplicaSetSize Property

Definition

Namespace:
System.Fabric.Description
Assembly:
System.Fabric.dll

In this Article

Gets or sets the minimum allowed replica set size for this service.

public int MinReplicaSetSize { get; set; }
Returns
Int32

The minimum allowed replica set size for this service.

Remarks

Defines the minimum number of replicas that Service Fabric will keep in its view of the Replica Set for a given partition. For example, if the is set to five (5) then normally (without failures) there will be five replicas in the view of the replica set. However this number will decrease during failures. The defines the minimum number of replicas in the view, so for example if the is five and the is three, then even if there are three concurrent failures (resulting in only two remaining replicas running) will still have three replicas in its view of the replica set (two up and one down). Since
uses majority quorum of the number of replicas maintained in this view, majority quorum of the is minimum level of reliability of any operation: in the prior example, with Target = 5 and Min = 3, with 3 concurrent failures, there are two remaining up replicas (and one down), and the majority quorum of 3 (the ) is 2. This means that the primary will continue to be able to replicate operations AND that the remaining secondary replica MUST apply the operation in order for the replica set (partition) to make progress. If the total number of replicas drops below the majority quorum of the then further writes will be disallowed.
